column5: hey again, this years been great so far many big fish for me including this big bucket mouth i got this mourning i dont know how this horseshoe up my ass but it can stay there, i dont mind not to sure how much she weighed but she was 21 inches heres a couple pix         hope you guys enjoyed
A 50" musky last week and now a big azz bass...your havin a good time for sure !!
what a hog!!
A great looking chunk of fish and some pretty good looking bass water behind you there. Congrats!
Nice bucket
Love the shirt,water yer fishing too. Nice bucket.  5 lbs maybe a bit much,not to burst your bubble.4+
Nice fish, whatdid it hit?   If his measurement was correct, that fish is easily 5+.
Not going to argue it. 21 inch is a good fish. Buckets at that length can be deceiving.Where as a smallie at that lenght, with big shoulder, can go 7. Just saying.    Still a great fish  walleye_man.

my last 5 pounder was also 21 inches if i can remeber correctly and that one was 5.5 it could be a nickle or not im happy no matter what she was a big fat fish  and i got her on a spro popper frog in that big pocket behind me in the 2nd pic
Very chunky, very nice  Congrats!
Nice one for sure. Gotta love them bucket hawgs  Congrats
Nice one man, your on a roll this year by the looks of it. Keep it going and keep the pics coming.
thats a fat one nice job
I'm almost up to 5, 1-pounders this year. That pretty much puts us in the same league.  All kidding aside, that's a beauty, this might end up being a record year for you! keep it up.
nice fish!  I would say its close to 5.  I have seen 5lbs bass that are in the 21 22 inch range.  Best way to figur eit out is to get a scale  Cheers!
Looks like a 5 lb smile on your face!!!! Congrats bud that's a fish any of us would be proud of!

Nice pig for sure. I caught one almost exactly the same 2 weeks ago.  It was 21" and it was thick.  I weighed it and it was 5.2 pounds.  I did not post its weight because I did not want any issues. Either way I was happy with the fish and I can see you are too.  That spot looks very familiar to me but since the comorants have taken roost nearby the fishing havs not been the same in the past 2-3 years.
Think that 5 lbs. or so is about right judging from other responses. Keep up the good year your having so far. Usually the fish are bigger and weigh more as fall approaches.
Very nice catch. Keep up the good work
4+ or 5...doesn't matter...that's a gorgeous bass!  Well done man!!!
